headline: Charlton Athletic Women sign Hammers’ Princess Ademiluyi on loan
summary: Charlton Athletic have secured the season-long loan signing of 18-year-old forward Princess Ademiluyi from West Ham United. She has spent the whole of her career to date with the Hammers and made eight first-team appearances […]

headline: Poppy Pritchard puts England Women’s U-19s into semi-finals
summary: England topped their UEFA Women’s U-19 Championship group with Poppy Pritchard scoring the only goal of the game against France. Michelle Agyemang headed a good chance wide for the Young Lionesses, Freya Godfrey saw her […]

headline: Ruby Mace returns to Leicester City Women in permanent deal
summary: Midfielder Ruby Mace has joined Leicester City on a two-year contract following a successful loan spell from Manchester City. The 20-year-old England U-23 international made 11 appearances for the Foxes in all competitions. following three […]

headline: Sophie Whitehouse signs for Charlton Athletic Women
summary: Charlton Athletic have signed 27-year-old goalkeeper Sophie Whitehouse from Lewes where she spent the last two seasons. She had a college career in the US before spells with Bristol city, Birmingham City and Tottenham Hotspur, followed […]

headline: Sheffield United Women sign goalkeeper Sian Rogers
summary: Sheffield United have signed experienced Barclays Women’s Championship goalkeeper Sian Rogers from Charlton Athletic. She helped the Addicks to a second-placed finish last season, her second campaign with the south London side. Having come through […]

headline: Six-goal Swifts to contest NIWFA Championship Cup Final
summary: Six-goal semi-finalists Sion Swifts and St James Swifts are to meet in the Northern Ireland Women’s FA Championship Cup Final. St James Swifts hit Ballymena United Women for six after going in four up at […]

headline: Glentoran edge Linfield out of Electric Ireland Women’s Cup
summary: Glentoran edged Linfield 2-1 on Friday evening to reach the Electric Ireland Women’s Challenge Cup quarter-finals. Jessica Foy opened the scoring for Glentoran, Linfield levelled at the start of the second half but Nadene Caldwell […]

headline: Portugal international goalkeeper Inês Pereira signs for Everton Women
summary: Portugal international goalkeeper Inês Pereira has joined Everton but will go out on a season-long loan to Spanish club Deportivo de La Coruña. She has around 40 caps for her country whom she represented at […]

headline: Costa Rica hold USWNT in Olympics send-off match
summary: The USA kept up their record of not conceding a goal under Emma Hayes but were held 0-0 at home by Costa Rica. Visiting goalkeeper, Noelia Bermúdez, frustrated the Americans with a dozen saves. Sophia […]

headline: Portsmouth Women sign defender Hannah Coan
summary: Portsmouth have signed defender Hannah Coan from Blackburn Rovers, where she was Young Player of the Year last season. The 23-year-old centre-back, who began her career at Everton, signed a contract that runs through to […]
